description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/7708614317 at Fri Aug 30 15:06:52 UTC 2024

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: /6h Degradation SLO \(5% of monthly error budget\).*/
/1h Outage SLO \(2% of monthly error budget\).*/

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: errortracking Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="errortracking"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="errortracking"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="errortracking"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="errortracking"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: /6h Degradation SLO \(5% of monthly error budget\).*/

panels.title: errortracking Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="errortracking"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="errortracking"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="errortracking"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"} > on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="errortracking"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: errortracking Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.

panels.title: loadbalancer SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="loadbalancer",monitor="global",type="errortracking"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="loadbalancer",monitor="global",type="errortracking"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="loadbalancer",monitor="global",type="errortracking"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="errortracking"} < on(tier, type, __tenant_id__) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="loadbalancer",monitor="global",type="errortracking"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.content:
### Description

Error Tracking allows developers to discover and view errors generated by their application



### Observability Tools

* [üìñ Kibana: Observability logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.severity,json.textPayload),filters:!((meta:(index:'2b3f598d-cf5a-4186-99f0-0075d9235c57',key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(index:'2b3f598d-cf5a-4186-99f0-0075d9235c57',key:json.type,params:errortracking,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:errortracking,type:phrase))))),index:'2b3f598d-cf5a-4186-99f0-0075d9235c57')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [üìà Kibana: Observability requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=2b3f598d-cf5a-4186-99f0-0075d9235c57&_a=(filters:!((meta:(index:'2b3f598d-cf5a-4186-99f0-0075d9235c57',key:json.stage,params:'$stage',type:phrase),query:(match:(json.stage:(query:'$stage',type:phrase)))),(meta:(index:'2b3f598d-cf5a-4186-99f0-0075d9235c57',key:json.type,params:errortracking,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.type:(query:errortracking,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:'@timestamp',interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
panels.title: Details

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
